content: khaleesi dragon scale halter top designed by earth tricks materials ​ worsted weight yarn f/4 5mm hook this pattern assumes a good working knowledge of the crocodile stitch if this stitch is unfamiliar for you try this project first to familiarize yourself with the stitch http //www ravelry com/patterns/library/dragon­egg­dice­bag this pattern is worked in several stages the bust is worked first beginning with a rectangular section which is worked with two points for the cups then working off the original chain of the bust a triangular section which covers the stomach is worked while you work if you feel your scales are too curly no fear steam blocking your completed piece will coax those scales to lay flatly *​note ​ this crocodile stitch varies from the traditional stitch between each 5dc cluster add a picot chain 3 slip_stitch into last double_crochet at the tip of each scale for a sharper better defined scale this pattern is written for a b­c cup size but the pattern is adjustable how to scale for a larger/smaller size ​ create the first row of 9 scales and hold it just below the fullest part of your breast if you feel it is not wide enough simply increase your starting chain by 6 and start the pattern with 10 scales if you feel it is too wide decrease your starting chain by 6 and start the pattern with 8 scales bust and cups chain 57 row 1 ​double_crochet into 5th chain from hook chain 1 double_crochet skip st double_crochet this makes a v­stitch repeat until ​17 v­stitches​ have been made chain 1 skip st double_crochet in last chain row 2 ​chain 3 and 4 double_crochet in the first double_crochet of the v­stitch chain 3 slip_stitch in first chain and 5 double_crochet in the second double_crochet of the v­stitch slip_stitch into the skipped stitch of the next v­stitch 5dc into first double_crochet of next v­stitch ch3 slip_stitch in first chain and 5 double_crochet in the second double_crochet of the v­stitch continue across completing 9 scales row 3 ​sl to center of last scale chain 4 double_crochet in same space v­stitch in the stitch between scales in the previous row v­stitch in chain space of next scale repeat and v­stitch across chain 1 double_crochet in chain space of the last scale ​16 v­stitch total row 4 ​repeat scale directions from row 2 ​completing 8 scales​ row 5 ​ without slip_stitch ing chain 4 and double_crochet into the last stitch of the previous row v­stitch in chain space of next scale v­stitch in the stitch between scales in the previous row repeat and v­stitch across v­stitch in the tip of the corner of the last scale ​17 v­stitch total row 6 ​chain 3 and work your first scale into the last v­stitch created on your 4th double_crochet of the first 5dc cluster slip_stitch into the edge of the scale from row 2 this will close the space between row 2 and 6 continue as normal with the formation
